he foreign affairs community suffered the loss of a true friend and staunch ad- vocate with the death of Ambassador Stephen Low, 82, on Nov. 5 at his home in Bethesda, Md., of congestive heart failure. Steve was not only an accom- plished scholar and Foreign Service of- ficer. He was an activist and visionary who sought to improve training for Americaâs diplomats and to expand understand- ing and appreciation of their history and contributions. During a 31-year career, Steve distinguished himself in numerous Foreign Service assignments, including service as a senior staff mem- ber at the National Security Council, ambassador to Zam- bia and Nigeria, and director of the For- eign Service Insti- tute for five years. He was best known for his role in the mediation process of the late 1970s that led to an independent Zimbabwe in 1980.
